title: Basic Math
description: BPL provides comprehensive arithmetic operations for both integers and floating-point numbers. Integer division truncates toward zero (10/3 = 3), while floating-point division preserves precision. The modulo operator (%) returns the remainder of integer division. Mixed-type arithmetic promotes to the wider type (int + float = float). This example demonstrates all basic arithmetic operators with both integer and floating-point values, showcasing operator precedence and type handling.
